wikipedia_page.main: Patrick Francis Maitland, 17th Earl of Lauderdale,  (17 March 1911 – 2 December 2008), styled The Hon. Patrick Maitland, Master of Lauderdale, from 1953 to 1968, was a Scottish Unionist politician.

response: * Patrick Maitland, 17th Earl of Lauderdale (1911–2008), Member of Parliament for Lanark (1951–1959)

The daughter of Patrick Maitland, 17th Earl of Lauderdale, and his wife Stanka (née Losanitch), Maitland was educated at St Mary and St Anne's School, Abbots Bromley, later the Abbots Bromley School for Girls, and the Lycée Français Charles de Gaulle in South Kensington.
Following the deaths of Patrick Maitland, 17th Earl of Lauderdale in December 2008 and Bert Hazell in January 2009, Allason became the oldest living former British Member of Parliament.

response: |Daughter of Patrick Maitland, 17th Earl of Lauderdale.
Maitland is the son of Patrick Maitland, 17th Earl of Lauderdale and his wife Stanka Lozanic. He was educated at Radley College and took an MA from Brasenose College, Oxford.

response: He was married to Olga Grujić, a court lady, the daughter of General Sava Grujić. They had two daughters, Stanko and Milica. Stanka was married to Patrick Maitland, 17th Earl of Lauderdale.
